intro: Betonica monticola, commonly known as mountain betony, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Betonica monticola is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
